intro: Crepis rifana, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils at high altitudes. Crepis rifana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas across the Alps and Carpathians.
